intro: Cephaelis stipulacea, commonly known as the pink fairy fan, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling a fan shape. It thrives in warm, humid climates and prefers well-drained soil. Cephaelis stipulacea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
